lines.text: I'm Little Bo Peep. I've lost my sheep, really I have. I can't find them anywhere, really, I can't. I think so, don't you? I do. They were such lovely sheep, really they were.
Ah, yes, my little chickadee. Let me inspect your tiny brood. Uh, so it's you.
Ha, ha, ha. Lovely day, lovely day. What a beautiful sunrise. Or is that your nose?
Why, you... Lucifer. I'll show you...
Now don't get hard-boiled, or I'll sic an egg beater on you.
I'll mow you down!
[Loses balance]
Look out below.
[Falls head first on a mushroom]
Bottoms up, Mr. Egg. Bottoms up.
[in See-Saw, Margery Daw, Edward G. Robinson and Greta Garbo are on a see-saw]
I vant so much to be alone.
Okay, babe. You asked for it.
[Gets off see-saw, Garbo falls down]
[in "Simple Simon", Oliver Hardy as the pieman throws a pie at Stan Laurel as Simple Simon, but misses; the pie goes flying past]
I've lost my sheep.
[the pie hits her in the face, covering her face black]

[imitating an African-American woman]
Is any o' you old folks seen my sheep anywhere?
My bowl, my bowl! Oh, yes, of course. Y-yes, my bowl.
You wanna buy a duck? Hee-hyuk, hee-hyuk, hee-hyuk!

[in bowl]
You wanna buy a duck? Ha, ha, ha, ha!
Hoo-hoo!
[Closes lid]
Hey, what's the big idea? Let me outta here!
It's mutiny!... but I love it.
